src:
„Bayern“ anksti suvaržiusi „Baskonia“ reabilitavosi po pralaimėjimo

02 Nov 2019, 00:17

Nuotr.: BNS





Nuotr. BNS
Po prieš kelias dienas patirto pralaimėjimo atsigavusi Vitorijos „Baskonia“ (3-3) penktadienio vakarą apgynė savo namų tvirtovę.
Ispanijos klubas Eurolygos susitikime 93:60 (29:10, 23:19, 14:18, 27:13) sutriuškino dar šią savaitę Madrido „Real“ krepšininkus nugalėjusią Miuncheno „Bayern“ (3-3) ekipą.
„Bayern“ komanda į duobę įkrito jau pirmajame kėlinyje, o po dviejų ketvirčių ji nuo varžovų atsiliko net 23 taškais – 29:52.
Nors trečiąjį kėlinį Tornike Shengelia ir Mattas Janningas užbaigė taikliais dvitaškiais, „Bayern“ sugebėjo atsilikimą sumažinti iki 19 taškų – 47:66.
Visgi lemiamame ketvirtyje Vokietijos klubas jėgų ir vėl pristigo, o nutolusi „Baskonia“ darbą užbaigė lengva pergale 33 taškų persvara.

„Baskonia“: Tornike Shengelia 19, Mattas Janningas 16 (3/6 trit.), Nikas Stauskas 12, Patricio Garino ir Achile Polonara (5 atk. kam.) po 10.


„Bayern“: Gregas Monroe 18, Maodo Lo 12 (3/5 trit.), Paulas Zipseris 7 (8 atk. kam.).




Rungtynių žaidėjas



Tornike Shengelia Taškai: 19 Naudingumas: 28 Dvitaškiai: 50% 4/8 Baudų metimai: 100% 5/5
text:
«Kuwait» receives .. «Jahra»

02 Nov 2019

KUWAIT: Kuwait Airways will receive an A320 Neo in December and three in 2020, Airbus Chairman Yousef Al-Jassem said in a statement. On the occasion of the arrival of the aircraft (Jahra) received by the company on Friday, the second of 15 aircraft of the same type that (Kuwait) is open to the possibility of expanding the number of passengers and freight services and destinations preferred by travelers. A plane purchased from the Airbus factory in 2014 pointing at the time of the related He pointed out that the Kuwaiti aircraft will receive other Airbus A330 aircraft in succession until 2026. The new planes include the latest models with high efficiency in operating economics, pointing out that they are designed to operate on short and medium-range lines and are characterized by reduced fuel consumption as they The aircraft has the capacity to transport cargo by approximately 9.5 tons, pointing out that the aircraft saves fuel consumption by 20 percent and the cost of maintaining the structure by 5 percent in addition to the decrease in operational costs by 14 Percent Kuwait Airways was established in 1953 as a private company under the name of (National Kuwait Airways Limited) began its first flight on March 16, 1954 acquired the Government of Kuwait on the full ownership of 100 percent in 1962, with a number of destinations around 50 destinations around the world.
